alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okmulgee; Osage; Pawnee; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 11:11PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN OSAGE...NORTHEASTERN CREEK...SOUTHWESTERN WAGONER...NORTHEASTERN OKMULGEE...NORTHWESTERN MUSKOGEE...SOUTHEASTERN PAWNEE AND SOUTHERN TULSA COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM CDT... At 1111 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Keystone State Park to 2 miles northwest of Boynton. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Mannford... Haskell... Kiefer... Westport... Taft... Keystone State Park... Walnut Creek State Park... Jenks Riverside Airport... Bald Hill... Stonebluff... Liberty... Gray... Jamesville... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 208 and 227. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Creek; Okmulgee; Osage; Pawnee; Tulsa; Wagoner
